perturbation.original_text: The Company shall also issue Consultant as soon as reasonably practicable warrants to purchase 1,250,000 shares of common stock in the form attached hereto as Annex A. The Company agrees to bear all costs and fees to be charged by the Company's transfer agent in respect of such shares.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall also issue Consultant as soon as reasonably practicable warrants to purchase 1,250,000 shares of common stock in the form attached hereto as Annex A. The Company *may* agree to bear all costs and fees to be charged by the Company's transfer agent in respect of such shares.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'agrees' to '*may* agree' introduces ambiguity regarding the company's responsibility for covering the transfer agent fees related to the warrant shares. This subtly shifts the obligation, making it less certain that the consultant will receive the warrants without incurring unexpected costs.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of offer and acceptance - Creates ambiguity regarding the definite terms.

perturbation.original_text: The Consultant's bonus payment level will be set at a minimum of 25% of the annual gross Base Consulting Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: The Consultant's bonus payment level will be set at a *suggested* minimum of 25% of the annual gross Base Consulting Fee.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will be set' to 'will be set *suggested*' introduces ambiguity regarding the company's responsibility for paying the minimum bonus. This subtly shifts the obligation, making it less certain that the consultant will be guaranteed this set amount. Making the contract vague in this area introduces a structural flaw in the bonus contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of offer and acceptance - Creates ambiguity regarding the definite terms.

perturbation.original_text: In the event this Agreement and the Consultant's engagement with the Company is terminated by the Company without Cause (other than for death or Disability or in connection with a change of control), then in addition to the amounts specified in Section 4.1 and subject to the Consultant's execution and non-revocation of a separation agreement containing a general release and waiver of liability against the Company and anyone connected with it in form acceptable to the Company, the Consultant shall be entitled to receive, and the Company shall pay the Consultant, two (2) years Base Consulting Fee (less statutory deductions and withholdings) in a single lump sum, paid in full within 30 days of termination. Further, Consultant shall be entitled to all vested common shares and, if applicable, options and warrants with vesting continuing for 12 months following termination as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event this Agreement and the Consultant's engagement with the Company is terminated by the Company without Cause (other than for death or Disability or in connection with a change of control), then in addition to the amounts specified in Section 4.1 and subject to the Consultant's execution and non-revocation of a separation agreement containing a general release and waiver of liability against the Company and anyone connected with it in form acceptable to the Company, the Consultant shall be entitled to receive, and the Company *may consider* paying the Consultant, two (2) years Base Consulting Fee (less statutory deductions and withholdings) in a single lump sum, paid in full within 30 days of termination. Further, Consultant shall be entitled to all vested common shares and, if applicable, options and warrants with vesting continuing for 12 months following termination as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall pay' to 'may consider paying' introduces ambiguity regarding the company's responsibility for paying the amount in the event that the Consultant is fired without cause. This subtly shifts the obligation, making it less certain that the consultant will receive this amount as it is not guaranteed. Making the contract vague in this area introduces a structural flaw in the termination contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of offer and acceptance - Creates ambiguity regarding the definite terms.
